result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian L Schommer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If the stayed portion of the sentence is imposed and there are outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall provide current financial information to the court.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Must report to Probation by 3:00 p.m. Thursday, May 28, 2015.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.  Must complete an anger management assessment and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.
CORRECTED 5/28/2015: DEFENDANT MUST COMPLETE AN ANGER MANAGEMENT ASSESSMENT IF RECOMMENDED BY AGENT.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian L Schommer

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brian L Schommer in court with attorney James H. Krave.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Agreement: Plead guilty to cout 1 as domestic abuse and as charged. DRI Count 2
Impose and stay 90 days jail.
Probation 18 months.
Court costs
AODA
Anger managment if recommended by Agent.  Any other counseling/evaluations recommended by probation.

Court questions defendant, defendant pleads guilty to count 1, Court accepts and finds guilty.  Count 2 is ordered dismissed and read-in.

Defendant addresses Court.  

Court relates and orders:
Impose and stay 90 days jail with huber and good time.  Credit for two days.
Probation 18 months.
Court costs
AODA and comply with any recommended treatment.
Anger managment if recommended by Agent.  Any other condtions recommended by probation.

Report to DOC by Thursday, May 28, 2015 at 3 PM.
of jury trial cancellation for trial that was scheduled for May 26, 2015

Defendant Brian L Schommer in court (telephonically) with attorney James H. Krave.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
No agreement. Proceed with Jury Trial.
from Attorney Krave to Court requesting Defendant not need appear for plea hearing - granted by Court
Plea hearing on May 6, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person on May 26, 2015 at 08:00 am.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.  
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.  
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold. 
Must have no contact with Tonia T.

Defendant Brian L Schommer in court with attorney Ryan O'Hara.  Defendant Brian L Schommer in custody.  Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant pleads not guilty on all counts.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
